name: King Charles III England Coast Path: Burnham-on-Crouch to Maldon

ai.summary: A hard coastal trek along the England Coast Path from Burnham-on-Crouch to Maldon in Essex, covering about 146.6 km. Expect long, exposed sections above estuary marshes, mudflats at low tide, and a mix of promenades and coastal trails with variable footing and weather.
ai.terrain_summary: Coastal terrain with estuary marshes, mudflats, and stretches of shingle or soft sand; promenade paths merge with uneven natural trails. Frequent wind exposure and variable footing, plus occasional muddy or slippery sections.
ai.safety_notes: Check tide times for estuary sections, as some paths may be cut off at high tide; be prepared for rapid weather changes on the coast; wear sturdy, waterproof footwear and dress in layers; carry a map, compass or GPS, and a charged mobile device with offline maps; stay away from cliff edges and unstable ground; hike with a partner or inform someone of your plans; carry enough water and snacks; signal coverage may be patchy in marshes.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or GPS device
Fully charged phone and power bank
Water bottle or hydration system and high-energy snacks
Headlamp or small flashlight with extra batteries
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) offer the best weather and daylight for this coastal route; winter hiking is possible but more challenging due to storms, mud, and shorter days.

seo.title: King Charles III England Coast Path: Burnham-on-Crouch to Maldon – 146.6 km Hard Coastal Trek
seo.meta_description: A 146.6 km hard coastal hike along the England Coast Path from Burnham-on-Crouch to Maldon in Essex, with estuaries, mudflats and wind-swept scenery.
seo.h1: King Charles III England Coast Path: Burnham-on-Crouch to Maldon
